channel.title: Disgruntled cocaine buyer phones Barnstable police
channel.description:
BARNSTABLE — Apparently, you just can't find reputable drug dealers these days. At 12:40 a.m. on Saturday, a man called the Barnstable police asking them to arrest another man because he had given the man $150 to buy cocaine, but the seller never handed over the drugs, the police said. "Can you imagine calling police for this?" Barnstable police Sgt. Sean Sweeney said. The caller said he was calling from Pitcher's Way. No arrests have been made, but Sweeney said the caller provided a name and phone number for the alleged drug dealer.
sauce: http://www.capecodonline.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/20090504/NEWS/905040313/-1/NEWS07 Oh god.. One of the dumbest things ever.

item.title: Disgruntled cocaine buyer phones Barnstable police
item.dc:creator: @haticks haticks
item.description:
@haticks wrote:

I remember watching cops one time…A Lady bought some cocaine from a guy, drove up to a cop, showed him the cocaine and told them who sold it too her so they would arrest her. ( Trying to be a good citizen and turn the dealer in) They arrested her. People can be really stupid sometimes.

Read full topic

@goatee wrote:

[quote=“TheBeanie, post:2, topic:277789”]Wouldnt it be £ instead of $?

Barnstable is in Devon in England.[/quote]

en.wikipedia.org

Barnstable, Massachusetts

Barnstable (/ˈbɑːrnstəbəl/ BARN-stə-bəl) is a city, referred to as the Town of Barnstable, in the U.S. state of Massachusetts and the county seat of Barnstable County. Barnstable is the largest community, both in land area and population, on Cape Cod. At the 2010 census it had a population of 45,193. The town contains several villages (one of which is also named Barnstable) within its boundaries. Its largest village, Hyannis, is the central business district of the county and home Barnstable tak...
